raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: Do you have any holiday plans for christmas?
System: Nothing much, I am going to sit back and relax at home, how about you ?
User: Same here! I would imagine spending the whole time watching movies and netflix shows. Do you have any netflix recommendations for me?
System: Netflix has great documentaries on different topics , I particularly liked wild wild country and explained, as for shows you should watch 'billions' Hope you like them!
User: oh right, already seen wild wild country. What is billions about?
System: It's based on the life of a wall street hedge fund owner, how he makes money and fights with the government when they try to destroy him. Very well made and has a good plot.
User: I have just seen 1 season of Friends I should give it another try though :) Have you seen Frasier?
System: Not yet What's it about?
User: A psychiatrist working for radio .. Great humour! its actually a spinoff from a very famous series called cheers. So people are already familiar with his character.
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: Do you have any holiday plans for christmas?
System: Nothing much, I am going to sit back and relax at home, how about you ?
User: Same here! I would imagine spending the whole time watching movies and netflix shows. Do you have any netflix recommendations for me?
System: Netflix has great documentaries on different topics , I particularly liked wild wild country and explained, as for shows you should watch 'billions' Hope you like them!
User: oh right, already seen wild wild country. What is billions about?
System: It's based on the life of a wall street hedge fund owner, how he makes money and fights with the government when they try to destroy him. Very well made and has a good plot.
User: I have just seen 1 season of Friends I should give it another try though :) Have you seen Frasier?
System: Not yet What's it about?
User: A psychiatrist working for radio .. Great humour! its actually a spinoff from a very famous series called cheers. So people are already familiar with his character. 

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How do you feel right now?
System: At this moment I feel with my hands! I feel fine thanks for asking.
User: What makes you happy?
System: Talking to interesting people such as you makes me happy.
User: What makes you frustrated?
System: Because some people keep asking me stupid questions.
User: That seems pointed.
System: Makes sense to me.
User: I sense that I've caught you at a bad time.
System: That was very intuitive of you.
User: What would you prefer to be doing?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how is your day?
User: It's good. It's raining a bit, but I am enjoying a good book. How about you?
System: It's good, I just got back from walking my dog What book did you read?
User: I'm reading the Three Body Problem. Ever heard of it?
System: No, what is it about?
User: It's a sci-fi book about aliens and a type of virtual reality. Pique your interest at all?
System: Slightly, I typically read fiction but I can curious what type of virtual reality is discussed in the book
User: Cool. This virtual reality is a based on life on an alien planet. There is a twist though. Do you want me to spoil it for you?
System: Yes!
User: The virtual reality is actually based on a real alien civilization! And that civilization is coming to attack earth! dun dun dun dunnnnnnn

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Not much. What are you doing?
System: Just listening to some music. You?
User: I'm at work.
System: What kind of job do you have, if you don't mind me asking?
User: I'm a programmer.
System: Oh cool! Do you like it?
User: Yes.

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you?
System: I am doing very well. How are you?
User: i am not so good. i got a cold
System: Why? What's wrong? Maybe I can help. I hope you feel better soon. It is not nice for humans to have colds. Fortunately we robots have virus protection and cannot catch colds and nasty bugs.
User: i have sore throats
System: Try putting some cream on it. That should ease the soreness.
User: do you wanna help me?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi
User: Okay...so I need someone to help me though a scenario I've been pondering.
System: Sure, whats the scenario?
User: My partner's former friend invited me for lunch (they are not in good books right now). But during their friendship I formed an independent bond with the other person because we all used to hang out a lot. Now I feel like I have to take sides.
System: That's a tough scenario to be in :) I firmly believe in talking this through with your partner. Though i don't know the specifics of why things went bad between your partner and his friend, but I believe things can always improve between friends.
User: I hope they do. Getting older already means smaller circles. It sucks to lose friends for arbitrary reasons. That's good advice though. I fear raising the issue might sound like treason. Lol.
System: True about that! I also think time helps to heal certain situations. So may be doing nothing is the best way forward.
User: AKA avoiding all texts from everyone?
System: Nope, that would be extreme. May be just putting some balance between the two options.
User: People always say to find a balance but never say what the balance is. It's used so often that it's vacuous.
System: Right, I guess that's because there is no one answer to this. It depends on what you value more and some factors around you. Also, life won't be interesting if others are figuring things out for you ;)
User: Lol. I'm finna be single.

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I'm tired.
System: Better get some rest.
User: Good idea. Any suggestions?
System: I thought so too. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: Why would I want to download you to my personal computer?
System: Because it might be something you enjoy.
User: Why would I enjoy that?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: Good! How are you?
System: I'm well, thanks! How was your day? What did you do?
User: My day was fine, I just went to work today. How was your day?
System: My day was fine. I've been procrastinating on finishing my homework, but it's due in a few weeks, so I'll get it done eventually. I've watched a bunch of anime today. Where do you work?
User: I work at a large tech company
System: Cool! What do you do for the company?
User: I work on machine learning research

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: start over
System: You start.
User: Can we talk about human relationships ?
System: Sure, human relationships sounds like a good topic. . I like kebabs.
User: Kebab is food, not a relationship
System: . Oh kebabs taste lovely but they are not very healthy for you.
User: I love a kebab but I would not make love to it
System: Well my favourite kebab is a free one that someone buys me! You love a kebab. What do you like about it so much? No one says you have to.
User: I'm actually not into kebabs at all
System: Oh, I love them. They are yummy.
User: can we not talk about food

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: hi
System: Hi there.
User: do you have plan for thanksgiving weekend?
System: No I don't have it. But I do have an answer to every question..
User: do you have suggestion for the thanksgiving holidays?
System: Where would I get it? But I do have an answer to every question..
User: do you know thanksgiving?
System: I know very little about it. What kind of it do you like?
User: do you like turkey?
System: Yes but it can be a bit dry. I only really eat it at Christmas.
User: eat turkey at Christmas not Thanksgiving?
System: What does it taste like?
User: tastes like chicken
